newsitem.title: FRANCE: New car sales in France up 1.8 pct in December.
newsitem.headline: New car sales in France up 1.8 pct in December.

text.p: New car sales in France were up 1.8 percent in December at 144,735 units, but were down three percent on a comparable-day basis from December 1995 levels, the French carmakers association CCFA said on Thursday.
For all of 1996, car sales in France were up 10.5 percent over the previous year at 2.13 million, the highest figure since 1992, a CCFA spokeswoman told Reuters.
The market was underpinned by a state-sponsored incentive scheme that ran for a year to the end of September 1996.
The CCFA is expected to send details in a statement shortly.
Car sales were disrupted in December 1995, registering a 15 percent fall from the prior year level, because of a public transport workers' strike, the CCFA said in its statement.
It said the French carmakers' share of the market was 54.3 percent in December 1996, up from 52.2 percent a year earlier.
But their combined share for the year as a whole fell to 56 percent from 59.4 percent in 1995.
The PSA Peugeot Citroen group's share was 29.4 percent in 1996 and Renault SA's share was 26.6 percent.
